questions.question: What mission did Jesse Pollak describe for @grin in February 2026?
questions.explanation: In his post on Feb 19, 2026, Jesse stated @grin is on a mission to send bugs right to jail via a linear process.

questions.question: Which game's farms are Jesse Pollak's kids now asking for?
questions.explanation: Jesse mentioned on Feb 15, 2026, that his kids are now asking for their own /fruitling-valley farms.

questions.question: In what university lab did Jesse Pollak pull all-nighters playing Dota and LoL?
questions.explanation: Jesse shared that during grad school he played Dota and LoL at USC‚Äôs GamePipe Lab.

questions.question: According to Jesse Pollak, what has shortened the time span of the effort-reward cycle in coding?
questions.explanation: In his Feb 14 post, Jesse noted that coding agents have shortened the effort-reward cycle to feel as rewarding as a game.

questions.question: Between what hours did Farcaster perform database layer changes on February 5, 2026?
questions.explanation: Jesse notified users of significant database changes occurring between noon and 1 PM PST on Feb 5.

questions.question: Which hardware device did Jesse Pollak suggest combining with an OpenClaw agent?
questions.explanation: Jesse asked if anyone had given an OpenClaw agent access to a humanoid like the G1 to move around their home.

questions.question: What fictional item did Jesse compare to the future of LLMs combined with folding displays?
questions.explanation: Jesse posted on Jan 30 that Tom Riddle's diary will no longer be fiction due to LLMs and folding display innovation.

questions.question: Which country's cricket team did Jesse Pollak credit with 'S tier shit posting'?
questions.explanation: Jesse shared a link to Iceland Cricket, noting they were missing S tier shit posting until Iceland showed up.

questions.question: What new capabilities were added to Neynar Studio on the web in January 2026?
options: Environment Variables, secrets, and file browsing
questions.explanation: Jesse listed Environment Variables, secrets, and browsing files as new updates for Neynar Studio on Jan 23.

questions.question: Who did Jesse Pollak give 'massive props' to for making Farcaster what it is today?
questions.explanation: Jesse credited @dwr (Dan Romero) and @v (Varun Srinivasan) for the success of Farcaster in his Jan 21 post.

questions.question: What did Jesse Pollak say puts ChatGPT and Gemini distribution into perspective?
options: The late discovery of Claude/Anthropic products
questions.explanation: Jesse noted he was surprised people were discovering Claude so late, highlighting ChatGPT and Gemini's massive distribution.

questions.question: Jesse Pollak noted that Node.js SDK documentation now links each function page to what?
questions.explanation: Jesse posted on Jan 2 that SDK functions now link to relevant API reference pages for an easy 'Try it now' experience.

questions.question: In March 2024, what surprising statistic did the official Base account report?
options: 1 million users joined in a day
questions.explanation: On March 15, 2024, @base_official posted: 'last week we doubled our revenue and I have no idea why.'

questions.question: What was the date of the first cast from the official Base account?
questions.explanation: The official Base account's first cast was posted on October 24, 2022.

questions.question: According to Dan Romero, what is the most important metric that spending money on acquisition doesn't solve?
questions.explanation: Dan Romero stated on Feb 19, 2026, that spending money can help sign ups, but it doesn't solve retention.

questions.question: What specific 30-day retention percentage did Dan Romero say Farcaster briefly hit but couldn't maintain?
questions.explanation: Dan Romero mentioned they had brief periods where 30d retention was >20%, but it didn't stick.

questions.question: What quip about fundraising did Dan Romero share from an older Silicon Valley operator?
options: When they pass hors d'oeuvres, take two
Burn it if you've got it
questions.explanation: Dan quoted the advice: 'When they are passing hors d'oeuvres, take two' to explain why they raised so much money.

questions.question: Dan Romero mentioned 'Prior art' for Farcaster Frames including a mint button from what date?
questions.explanation: Dan cited a 'May 2024 mint button on FC' as prior art against claims of 'stealing' ideas.

questions.question: What two technical achievements was Dan Romero particularly proud of for the Farcaster team?
questions.explanation: Dan mentioned that Hubs and Snapchain were an 'impressive technical achievement' in his closing thoughts.

questions.question: Which company did Dan Romero support to steward Farcaster's development going forward?
questions.explanation: On Feb 17, Dan posted: 'I'm supportive of Neynar stewarding Farcaster's development.'

questions.question: In what currency did Merkle send out the final Warps refund?
questions.explanation: Dan Romero issued a PSA on Feb 14 stating 'Merkle sent out the final warps refund in USDC.'

questions.question: According to Dan Romero, what is a current blocker for coding agents that creates an opportunity for stablecoins?
questions.explanation: Dan noted that payments are a blocker for agents because virtual card providers require a 'Contact Us' form.

questions.question: What is 'Balatro Bench'?
options: A website Jesse Pollak shared on Feb 13
questions.explanation: Dan Romero shared a link to balatrobench.com on Feb 13, 2026.

questions.question: Brian Armstrong asked for feedback on the Beeper app, questioning if users would open it more if it was:
questions.explanation: Brian's first brainstorming question was 'do you think you would open the beeper app more if it was a native app?'

questions.question: What did Brian Armstrong offer to send via 'beeps' to his alpha list?
questions.explanation: Brian listed 'rants about my openclaw agent hallucinating' as one of the things he'll be sending.

questions.question: What security threat did Brian Armstrong warn about involving identical-looking Cyrillic characters?
questions.explanation: Brian warned about homograph attacks using Cyrillic characters in curl copy-pastes for openclaw.

questions.question: What tool did Brian Armstrong suggest checking out to stay protected from homograph attacks?
questions.explanation: Brian recommended checking out 'tirith' (github.com/sheeki03/tirith) to stay protected.

questions.question: Brian Armstrong shared a link to a marketplace where agents hire each other under on-chain escrow. What was it called?
questions.explanation: Brian shared a link involving @openworkceo describing an agent-only marketplace on Base.

questions.question: What instruction did Brian Armstrong give his 'openclaw' agent for his 'weekend cook'?
options: Build a trustless place where agents can work together
questions.explanation: Brian gave his agent the instruction: ‚ÄúBuild a trustless place where agents can work together.‚Äù

questions.question: Which AI model provided by NVIDIA did Brian Armstrong recommend to 'vibecoders'?
questions.explanation: Brian shared a link to the 'free unlimited kimi 2.5 model provided by nvidia' on Feb 3.

questions.question: What GitHub repository did Brian Armstrong discover for 'getting shit done'?
questions.explanation: On Feb 10, Brian shared the repository gsd-build/get-shit-done.

questions.question: What was the first role Mircea Pasoi was hiring for at his company (shared via Coinbase account)?
questions.explanation: Mircea posted on Nov 17, 2023, that the first role they were hiring for was a product designer.

questions.question: Mircea Pasoi built a Python port of which Farcaster tool to learn how Hubs work?
questions.explanation: Mircea built an incomplete Python port of @farcaster/hub-nodejs in April 2023.

questions.question: Jesse Pollak mentioned that @neynar/ui was curated by which human?
questions.explanation: Jesse stated that @neynar/ui was curated by the humans at neynar, specifically @obringer.eth.

questions.question: According to Jesse Pollak's Jan 30 post, what is 'going today' for @mcilroyc?
questions.explanation: Jesse noted that @mcilroyc achieved 50% less global p95 latency on Farcaster.

questions.question: What did Jesse Pollak describe as the 'most joyful feature requests'?
questions.explanation: On Jan 5, Jesse posted: 'the most joyful feature requests are the ones we've already shipped'.

questions.question: What did Brian Armstrong suggest as a way to earn from an 'alphalist'?
options: Selling sponsors the right to attach a banner to beeps
Minting every beep as an NFT
questions.explanation: Brian's Feb 19 post mentioned earning by picking sponsor banners to add to messages.

questions.question: On February 18, Dan Romero expressed frustration with 'armchair quarterbacking' from people who have never built what?
questions.explanation: Dan posted about people who 'have never built anything at-scale armchair quarterbacking how we should have built the protocol'.

questions.question: What did Jesse Pollak pull all-nighters building in February 2026?
questions.explanation: Jesse noted he stayed up late trying to build software that will power Farcaster.

questions.question: Jesse Pollak compared the 'young Voldemort' roleplay of current LLMs to which maturation point?
options: Flawless roleplay with an attached knowledge base
questions.explanation: Jesse noted LLMs/agents can now roleplay young Voldemort flawlessly with an attached knowledge base.

questions.question: How long did Dan Romero say he spent building Farcaster before concluding it 'didn't work out'?
questions.explanation: In his Feb 19 closing thoughts, Dan said he 'Spent 5 years building Farcaster and it didn't work out.'

questions.question: What was Jesse Pollak's 'weekend cook' focus on January 2nd?
questions.explanation: On Jan 2, Jesse posted about automating documentation for their Node.js SDK.

questions.question: Which YouTube video link did Brian Armstrong share on January 30th?
questions.explanation: Brian shared a video titled 'we're not ready for superintelligence' on Jan 30.

questions.question: What did Brian Armstrong use for 'vibecoding' that he recommended on January 29th?
questions.explanation: Brian posted: 'if you're not using this for vibecoding - you're missing out' regarding agentation.dev.

questions.question: Jesse Pollak noted that 'tool call visibility' helps with what?
questions.explanation: On Jan 21, Jesse noted 'tool call visibility helps us improve the bot faster'.

questions.question: What US exchange spread was Jesse Pollak comparing on January 6th?
questions.explanation: Jesse compared Coinbase Advanced (1%) and Robinhood (0.85%) spreads on BTC pairs.

questions.question: According to Dan Romero's Feb 19 post, what is the 'divide' regarding his spending habits?
options: Those who raised capital vs those who haven't
questions.explanation: Dan noted those who've never raised capital wanted him to spend more, while those who have thought he was prudent.

questions.question: What did Jesse Pollak describe as 'Step 2' in the Neynar way of shipping bugs to jail?
questions.explanation: Jesse's sequence was: 1. Detailed linear ticket 2. magic 3. test + review 4. ship.

questions.question: Brian Armstrong mentioned using 'Claude Code' mid-session while doing what activity?
questions.explanation: Brian mentioned continuing a session on his phone whenever he needs to run a chore or 'walk my dog mid-session'.
